MCQ: Who coined the term 'machine learning' in 1959?
Choices: a: Donald Hebb | b: Tom M. Mitchell | c: Arthur Samuel | d: Walter Pitts

MCQ: What was the earliest machine learning model introduced by Arthur Samuel?
Choices: a: A program for calculating winning chance in checkers | b: A program for analyzing sonar signals | c: A program for recognizing speech patterns | d: A program for classifying data based on models

MCQ: Who proposed the early mathematical models of neural networks for machine learning algorithms?
Choices: a: Raytheon Company | b: Warren McCulloch | c: Duda and Hart | d: Nilsson

MCQ: What is the objective of modern-day machine learning in classifying data?
Choices: a: To predict future outcomes | b: To make decisions based on experience | c: To develop new algorithms | d: To classify data based on models

MCQ: According to Tom M. Mitchell, when does a computer program learn from experience?
Choices: a: When it improves its performance at tasks | b: When it is trained by a human operator | c: When it recognizes patterns in data | d: When it uses reinforcement learning
